title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 18 ยง 400.2 - Definitions
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 18 ยง 400.2 - Definitions

State Regulations

Those terms used often in this Subchapter are defined as
follows: (a) Categories of individuals
means grouping of persons on the basis of common characteristics such as
recipient status (aid to dependent children, supplemental security income, Medicaid), income level, age and physical or mental condition. (b) Comprehensive annual social services
program plan means the annual statewide services plan prepared by the
department for each program year in accordance with the requirements of title
XX of the Federal Social Security Act. (c) Department means the New York State

Department of Social Services, the State agency empowered by section
20
of the

Social Services Law to supervise the administration of public welfare programs
in the State of New York and the State agency designated by the Governor to
supervise administration of the State's program for the provision of services
in accordance with the requirements of title XX of the Federal Social Security

Act. (d) District component means
the services plan element for a designated geographic area which is prepared by
the social services district under the supervision and subject to the approval
of the department for incorporation in the comprehensive annual social services
program plan. (e) Geographic area
means an area within the State such as a county or a group of counties which is
identifiable for the purposes of planning and administration of social services
programs. Each social services district is designated by the department as a
distinct geographic area. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 18
ยง
400.2

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
